text:
WordPress recently introduced <https://wordpress.org/patterns/> and it made me think about how some customers request using their global header/footer on a purchased theme/template. Has there been any thought on how to accomodate someone who wants to add functionality to an existing theme?

Buyer 1: I am brand new to HubSpot and need a theme that contains everything i need.
Buyer 2: I already have a primary theme with a global header and footer. I want to add more functionality to this existing theme.

What if all of these are buyable in the marketplace? You can buy a kit or parts.
Themes - header/footer - global theme styles
Templates - Can be added to any theme. All styles and scripts are scoped or inherit global values. (includes sections and modules)
Sections - Can be added to any theme. All styles and scripts are scoped or inherit global values. (may include modules)
Modules - Can be added to any theme. All styles and scripts are scoped or inherit global values.

In order for this work I think there would need to be some standardization for themes with mandatory theme style fields and header/footer partials. Then any sub elements can use those values and be interchangeable between themes. This standardization could be optional but if used the asset could have a flag that says "supports cross compatibility" OR "interchangeable".
